title: permeant ban/ apology
body:
so i recently got permanently banned and i am thinking is there another way i could get punished other than a permanent ban maybe permanent chat restriction?
anyways Im sorry for what i have said/did and i hope you can consider another chance

i am minimising my chat and removing /all chat and what to know if there is anything else i can do to improve chatting nicely/safely

replies.body:

Im seeing alot of permanent bans for things that seem to not deserve it or didnt happen

It's not easy to get banned, and you will never get banned for no reason. If a ban is truly made in error then Riot will reverse it. The average player will never have any interaction with any of the punishments systems, except maybe the occasional 5 min queue timer for an accidental dodge (and that isn't technically a punishment unless it's a ranked dodge but more like a "are you sure you're ready").

OP was consistently toxic, perma ban was his third punishement. Typically for toxicity there are four punishement tiers and you will face each on ein order. The tiers are 10 game chat restriction > 25 game chat restriction > 14 day ban > perma ban.

OP mentioned below that he never recieved a 14 day ban, in severe cases the system will skip punishment tiers. This is usually reserved for things like death threats and hate speech. In the really bad cases you can face an immediate permanent ban.

HOWEVER, all that said, you won't be punished just for one bad game where you get really frustrated and say more in chat than you should. So long as you aren't consistently or frequently toxic, don't intentionally feed, don't steal peoples roles in ranked etc etc then you are pretty safe. 

The things you will normally be instantly banned for are pretty much impossible to do accidentally. Those include things like account buying/selling, scripting/cheating/hacking/utilising disallowed 3rd party programs and the like.

Bear in mind that account sharing is also punishable. Typically it won't be unless it is used for boosting/cheating and the like, but do so at your own risk.

So i've never received any of these messages saying you were reported or anything like that

im assuming i'll receive these messages first

> Moving forward, we'll be replacing the current iteration of Behavior Alerts/warnings with one that interacts directly with the instant feedback system. Warnings will come with reform cards, and as a result should never be a surprise or confusing to the recipient.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/AsT95gjr-i-was-reported-for-verbal-harassment?comment=000100000000

Basically this means they are removing the bahaviour alerts (the little popup you get) because they were misleading, so your first 'warning' will be in the form of your first punishment (usually the 10 game chat restriction). 

That said, unless you are going out of your way to attack someone or be offensive, there's no reason you'd be punished. Even using words considered offensive aren't punished in and of themselves, it depends on context.

It comes down to intent. If your intent is to make someone feel bad for any reason (even if it's reactionary) you will face punishments (and not typically for a one time thing). If it's just general frustration you don't really have to worry.

In extreme cases the system is capable of skipping punishment tiers. Typically there are four tiers, 10 game chat rest, 25 game chat rest, 14 day ban then into perma, but if the behaviour is severe enough the system will escalate the punishment to the next tier.


> You can be perma-banned without any previous punishments if your behavior is severe enough. You can also skip individual punishment levels.

[SOURCE](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/nu6A0TNn-perma-banned?comment=0003)

Without knowing your situation I can't say if this was the case or if it was some other reason (intent feeding has a slightly different punishment for example). Unfortunately, a punishment will only be revoked if it was made in error, which does not appear to be the case. You can appeal with support of you wish, but it is extremely unlikely they can do anything for you.

If you spent any money on skins etc for your acc and you're Australian you could now try the ACCC.

You do not own your account, you lease it from Riot. Riot has the legal right to ban you and not offer you any form of refund or recompense, in the same you can be kicked out of a house you rent and will not be given back the rent you have paid.
It is not like a house at all, and you should have more faith in your rights as a consumer.

I have plenty of faith in my right as a consumer, but you LEASE the account from Riot, you do not OWN it, and thus are not entitled to a refund if your account gets banned. The laws covered by the ACCC ONLY apply if you own the content.
